intro: Cyphostemma kilimandscharicum, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro moonvine, is a climbing plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, and it bears yellow, fleshy fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
